location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to Government at Bombay Castle, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter from Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to Government of Bombay, to Lieutenant William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, transmitting a copy of a letter sent on the same day by Warden to R T Goodwin, Secretary and Translator in the Office of the Country Correspondence, forwarding a translation of a letter from Cassee Ghobab, East India Company's Broker at Muscat, to Sir Evan Nepean, Governor of Bombay, dated 5 March 1814, giving an update on the reconciliation between two local rulers, Mahomed bin Sulamu [Mohammed bin Sulayem] and His Highness Syyud Iaced, and informing that Mahomed bin Sulamu had suggested that British ships were marked, so that the Joasimees [Qasimi] would not molest them.
